title: Continuation of the National Emergency With Respect to Ethiopia
summary: The document is a notice from the President of the United States, dated September 8, 2025, regarding the continuation of a national emergency with respect to Ethiopia. The emergency, initially declared on September 17, 2021, via Executive Order 14046, addresses the unusual and extraordinary threat to U.S. national security and foreign policy posed by the situation in northern Ethiopia. The ongoing conflict in the region continues to threaten peace, security, and stability in Ethiopia and the Horn of Africa. As a result, the President has extended the national emergency for another year, in accordance with the National Emergencies Act. The notice is published in the Federal Register and transmitted to Congress.
